results.title: Distinguished guests
results.creator_credit: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Christopher (Colin Friels) is sure he really likes psychology - but not the way it is taught at his university. Professor Wiseman, his tutor, is a disciple of the eminent European pyschologist, Professor Eisenbach - a cold rational behaviourist whose books are always cited as authorities. As a joke, Christopher and his girlfriend decide that he will impersonate Eisenbach and teach Professor Wiseman a lesson. Co-written by PJ Hogan (Muriel’s Wedding). Also features Tracy Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS

results.title: Distinctively Australian
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Under southern skies”.
Series presenter, Dr Susie Hanckel, leaves her city environment to examine what makes the ecosystems in our 400million year old country distinctively Australian. She looks at the adaptation of plants to the extremes of Australian climatic conditions - from the arid deserts and the snow covered eucalypts of the Australian Alps to the rainforests of North Queensland. This episode features distinguished scientist and specialist on Australia’s High Country, Alec Costain.

results.title: Distillation
results.creator_credit: Peter Baylis, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of distillation illustrates by examples of methods used in the fractional distillation of crude oil. Studies the following: size of atoms; structure of the hydrocarbon molecules; crude oil mixture of different compounds which are separated for commercial use into petrol and lubricating oils; fractional distillation of mixtures of hydro-carbons by laboratory and industrial processes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Baylis, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Film Unit

results.title: Distemper in dogs
results.brief_description: Describes how distemper in dogs may be treated and how the disease may be prevented from affecting healthy dogs by the use of appropriate injections.

results.title: Distant voices, still lives
results.creator_credit: Terence Davies, Jennifer Howarth, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Channel Four and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: This is the first feature film of Liverpudlian Terence Davies, obviously autobiographical, dealing with a family named Davies and their lives during the 1940s and 1950s. The film is divided into two parts: “Distant voices” (45 mins) centers on the wedding of Eileen, eldest of the three Davies children, and the funeral of her father, events which spark memories of the past, including the frightening war years when the city was bombed frequently. “Still lives” (39 mins), actually filmed two years after the first part, with the same actors but with a substantially different crew. It’s a seamless continuation of the recollections of their domineering and irrational father, played against music and radio programmes of the period to create an evocative and moving picture of family life in the 1940s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terence Davies, Jennifer Howarth, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Channel Four and British Film Institute

results.title: Distant neighbours
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Humphrey Swingler, British Petroleum and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of light aircraft in maintaining communications with remote settlements, showing services operating in the Isle of Barra in the Outer Hebrides, in the frozen North-West Territory of Canada and in the desert outback of Central Australia.

results.title: Distant islands
results.creator_credit: Bettina Maylone, Jack Long and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: As in her previous film, the award-winning The Hometown, the filmmaker has used applique and embroidered tapestries to animate a story from her childhood. Distant Islands recalls a young girl’s happy summers spent sailing with her family off the coast of British Columbia. Each tapestry, meticulously stitched by hand with brightly colored yarns, evokes a memory of leisurely days at sea, drifting among the islands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bettina Maylone, Jack Long and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Distant harmony
results.brief_description: A joyous celebration of Luciano Pavarotti’s sensational 1986 China tour. The beauty of Pavarotti’s soaring voice combines with the cultural magic of imperial China to reaffirm the universality of art through the glories of Italian opera. Accompanied by the Genoa Opera Company, with whom performed ‘La Boheme’, Pavarotti’s natural gregariousness and great talent make him a larger-than-life presence and a perfect ambassador of culture and good will.
